questions.question: Hill CLimbing is an example of which programming method

explanations.a: Hill Climbing is a greedy algorithm, which always makes the choice that looks best at the moment.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a variant of hill climbing:

explanations.b: Genetic algorithm is not a variant of hill climbing

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding Hill Climbing?

answers.a: Hill Climbing may get stuck at local optimas
answers.b: Hill climbing does not look ahead beyond the immediate neighbors of the current state
answers.c: Hill Climbing is not a complete algorithm

explanations.d: All of the above statements are true

questions.question: Which of the following is a shortcoming of Hill Climbing?

explanations.d: It is not possible to determine the best direction to move in, when the current state is at a plateau

questions.question: Which technique is used to overcome the problem of getting stuck at local optima in Hill Climbing?

explanations.c: Side ways move and simulated annealing are two techniques used to overcome the problem of getting stuck at local maxima

questions.question: In which scenario, Hill Climbing might be a good choice?

answers.a: When the search space is continuous and smooth
answers.b: When the objective function is non differentiable
answers.c: When the objective function has many peaks and valleys
answers.d: When the search space is discrete and has a well defined structure

explanations.d: Hill Climbing converges quickly when the search space is discrete and has a well defined structure
